meanings.definition: To go beyond or exceed (a limit or boundary)
meanings.sent1: The car overshot the stop sign and had to reverse.
meanings.sent2: The basketball player overshot the hoop and missed the shot.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overshot the tree branch and landed in a pile of leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overshot her ability to stay calm.
meanings.sent5: The rocket overshot its target and disappeared into the sky.

meanings.definition: To pass or fly over (a target or destination)
meanings.sent1: The bird overshot the nest and had to circle back.
meanings.sent2: The plane overshot the runway during landing.
meanings.sent3: The kite overshot the tree and got stuck in the branches.
meanings.sent4: His ambition overshot his current capabilities.
meanings.sent5: The arrow overshot the bullseye and hit the outer ring.

meanings.definition: An act of shooting or going beyond a target or limit
meanings.sent1: The overshoot of the arrow surprised the archer.
meanings.sent2: The overshoot of the rocket was visible from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The overshoot of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The overshoot of the budget caused financial strain.
meanings.sent5: The overshoot of the marathon runner impressed the spectators.
